class pytweet.abc.Messageable(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: Protocol

Represent an object that can send and receive a message through DM. Verion Added: 1.0.0

data: Dict[str, Any]

The complete data of a Messageable that can send and receive a message.

http_client: Optional[HTTPClient]

The HTTPClient that make the request.

send(text=None, **kwargs)

Send a message to a specific Messageable object. Verion Added: 1.1.0

delete_message(message_id, **kwargs)

Delete a message from a Messageable object. Verion Added: 1.1.0

follow()

Follow a Messageable object. Verion Added: 1.1.0

unfollow()

Unfollow a Messageable object. Verion Added: 1.1.0

block()

Block a Messageable object. Verion Added: 1.2.0

unblock()

class pytweet.client.Client(bearer_token, *, consumer_key=None, consumer_key_secret=None, access_token=None, access_token_secret=None)

Bases: object

Represent a client that connected to Twitter! This client will interact with other through twitter’s api version 2! Version Added: 1.0.0

bearer_token: str

The Bearer Token of the app. The most important one, because this make most of the requests for twitter’s api version 2.

consumer_key: Optional[str]

The Consumer Key of the app.

consumer_key_secret: Optional[str]

The Consumer Key Secret of the app.

access_token: Optional[str]

The Access Token of the app.

access_token_secret: Optional[str]

The Access Token Secret of the app.

http: Optional[HTTPClient]

Return a :class: HTTPClient, HTTPClient is responsible for making most of the Requests to twitter’s api.

property user

User: Return the client in user object, return None if access token isnt specified. Version Added: 1.2.0

Type

class

get_user(user_id)

A function for HTTPClient.get_user(). Version Added: 1.0.0

This function return a :class: User object.

get_user_by_username(username)

A function for HTTPClient.fetch_user_byusername(). Version Added: 1.0.0

This function return a :class: User object.

get_tweet(tweet_id)

A function for HTTPClient.fetch_tweet(). Version Added: 1.0.0

This function return a :class: Tweet.

tweet(text, **kwargs)

Post a tweet directly to twitter from the given paramaters. Version Added: 1.1.0

text: str

The tweets text, it will showup as the main text in a tweet.

stream()

Stream in real-time, roughly a 1% sample of all public Tweets. Version Added: 1.1.0

exception pytweet.errors.Unauthorized

Bases: Exception

Raised when the Credentials you passed is invalid!

exception pytweet.errors.NotFoundError

Bases: Exception

Raised when it cant find the object in some functions.

exception pytweet.errors.TooManyRequests

Bases: Exception

Raised when you made TooManyRequest

exception pytweet.errors.Forbidden

Bases: Exception

Raised when a request return status code: 403

exception pytweet.errors.PytweetException

Bases: Exception

Raised when you made TooManyRequest

Bases: object

class pytweet.http.HTTPClient(bearer_token, *, consumer_key, consumer_key_secret, access_token, access_token_secret)

Bases: object

Represent the http/base client for :class: Client! This http/base client have methods for making requests to twitter’s api! Verion Added: 1.0.0

bearer_token: str

The Bearer Token of the app. The most important one, because this make most of the requests for twitter’s api version 2.

consumer_key: Optional[str]

The Consumer Key of the app.

consumer_key_secret: Optional[str]

The Consumer Key Secret of the app.

access_token: Optional[str]

The Access Token of the app.

access_token_secret: Optional[str]

The Access Token Secret of the app.

credentials

The credentials in a dictionary

request(route, *, headers={}, params={}, json={}, auth=False, is_json=True, mode=None)

Make an HTTP Requests to the api. Verion Added: 1.0.0

This function make an HTTP Request with the given paramaters then return a dictionary in a json format.

fetch_user(user_id, http_client, pinned_tweet=False)

Make a Request to optain the user from the given user id. Verion Added:1.0.0

This function return a :class: User object.

fetch_user_byusername(username, http_client)

Make a Request to optain the user from their username, A Username usually start with ‘@’ before any letters. If a username named @Jack, then the username argument must be ‘Jack’. Verion Added:1.0.0

This function return a :class: User.

fetch_tweet(tweet_id, http_client)

Fetch a tweet info from the specified id. Return if consumer_key or consumer_key_secret or access_token or access_token_secret is not specified. Verion Added:1.0.0

tweet_id: ObjectID

The tweet id you wish to fetch it.

http_client

The http client that make the request.

This function return a :class: Tweet.

send_message(user_id, text, **kwargs)

WARNING: this function isnt finish yet! Verion Added:1.1.0

Make a post Request for sending a message to a Messageable object.

delete_message(id, **kwargs)

WARNING: this function isnt finish yet! Verion Added:1.1.0

Make a DELETE Request for deleting a certain message in a Messageable object.

post_tweet(text, **kwargs)

WARNING: this function isnt finish yet! Verion Added:1.1.0

Make a POST Request to post a tweet to twitter from the client itself.

follow_user(user_id)

Make a POST Request to follow a Messageable object. Verion Added:1.1.0 Updated: 1.2.0

user_id: ObjectID

The user’s id that you wish to follow, better to make it a string.

unfollow_user(user_id)

Make a DELETE Request to unfollow a Messageable object. Verion Added:1.1.0 Updated: 1.2.0

user_id: ObjectID

The user’s id that you wish to unfollow, better to make it a string.

block_user(user_id)

Make a POST Request to Block a Messageable object. Verion Added:1.2.0

user_id: ObjectID

The user’s id that you wish to block, better to make it a string.

unblock_user(user_id)

Make a DELETE Request to unblock a Messageable object. Verion Added:1.2.0

user_id: ObjectID

The user’s id that you wish to unblock, better to make it a string.

class pytweet.tweet.Tweet(data, **kwargs)

Bases: object

Represent a tweet message from Twitter. A Tweet is any message posted to Twitter which may contain photos, videos, links, and text. .. versionadded: 1.0.0

data: TweetPayload

The complete data of a tweet keep inside a dictionary.

original_payload

Represent the main data of a tweet.

_payload

Same as original_payload but its inside the ‘data’ key.

_includes

Same as original_payload but its inside the ‘_includes’ key..

tweet_metrics

Represent the public metrics of the tweet.

property text

Return the tweet’s text.

Type

str

property id

Return the tweet’s id.

Type

int

property author

User]: Return a user (object) who posted the tweet.

Type

Optional[

Type

class

property retweeted_by

User]]: Return a list of users thats retweeted the specified tweet’s id. Maximum users is 100. Return 0 if no one retweeted.

Type

Optional[List[

Type

class

property liking_users

User]]: Return a list of users that liked the specified tweet’s id. Maximum users is 100. Return 0 if no one liked.

Type

Optional[List[

Type

class

property sensitive

Return True if the tweet is possible sensitive to some users, else False

Type

bool

property created_at

datetime.datetime: Return a datetime object with the tweet posted age.

Type

class

property source

Return the source of the tweet. e.g if you post a tweet from a website, the source is gonna be ‘Twitter Web App’

Type

str

property reply_setting

Return the reply setting. If everyone can replied, reply_setting return ‘Everyone’

Type

str

property lang

Return the tweet’s lang, if its english it return en.

Type

str

property convertion_id

Return the tweet’s convertion id.

Type

int

property reply_to

User]: Return the user that you reply with the tweet, a tweet count as reply tweet if the tweet startswith @Username or mention a user. .. versionadded: 1.1.3

Type

Type

User], bool]: Return the mentioned users, if there isnt it return False. .. versionadded: 1.1.3

class pytweet.user.User(data, **kwargs)

Bases: pytweet.abc.Messageable

Represent a user in Twitter. User is an identity in twitter, its very interactive. Can send message, post a tweet, and even send messages to other user through Dms.

data: UserPayload

The complete data of the user through a dictionary in a UserPayload format form!

original_payload

Represent the main data of a tweet.

http_client

Represent a :class: HTTPClient that make the request.

user_metrics

Represent the public metrics of the user.

property name

Return the user’s name.

Type

str

property username

Return the user’s username, this usually start with ‘@’ follow by their username.

Type

str

property id

Return the user’s id.

Type

id

property bio

Return the user’s bio.

Type

str

property description

an alias to User.bio

Type

str

property profile_link

Return the user’s profile link

Type

str

property link

Return url where the user put links, return an empty string if there isnt a url

Type

str

property verified

Return True if the user is verified account, else False.

Type

bool

property protected

Return True if the user is protected, else False.

Type

bool

property avatar_url

Return the user profile image.

Type

Optional[str]

property location

Return the user’s location

Type

str

property created_at

datetime.datetime: Return datetime.datetime object with the user’s account date.

Type

class

property pinned_tweet

Tweet]: Returns the user’s pinned tweet. Verion Added: 1.1.3

Type

Optional[

Type

class

property followers

User]: Returns a list of users who are followers of the specified user ID.

Type

List[

Type

class

property following

object]: Returns a list of users thats followed by the specified user ID.

Type

List[

Type

class

property followers_count

Return total of followers that a user has.

Type

int

property following_count

Return total of following that a user has.

Type

int

property tweet_count

Return total of tweet that a user has.

Type

int

property listed_count

Return total of listed that a user has.

Type

int
